page.title: 16Ockley Manor Farm
page.content: Between Burgess Hill and Hassocks are fields. Some of the fields are used for cattle and others for growing cereals and grass to make hay for use during the winter. There is one herd of forty-six cattle divided between two fields; eleven in one and thirty-five in the other. They are bullocks and heifers. The majority of the fields are used for growing barley. The fields are divided by hawthorn hedges and barbed wire fences. The gates are made of wood or metal. There is a track through the fields that is also a public footpath. One of the fields with cows in it backs on to private gardens. The farmer regularly checks the fences for poisonous plants that the cattle might eat.
